articles.author: Jesse Rubin
articles.title: Palestinian-American businessman, 57, is arrested by ICE in Cleveland, shocking supporters
articles.description: Palestinian-American business owner Amer Othman al Adi has been in the country nearly 40 years. Today the 57-year-old sits in the Geauga County jail awaiting deportation — the first time Adi has seen the inside of a jail cell, and a shock to his congressman a…

articles.author: Andy Long
articles.title: ICE officials arrest Ohio business owner, plan to deport him
articles.description: Adi will be jailed in Geauga County. He is on a hunger strike, saying he won’t eat until the problem is resolved.

articles.author: Suzanne Stratford
articles.title: Youngstown business owner taken into custody by ICE could get stay in deportation
articles.description:
A Youngstown businessman who was taken into custody by Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents Tuesday in Brooklyn Heights might soon get a stay in deportation.

Amer “Al Adi” Othman thought he was meeting with officials, but was instead arrested by ICE a…

articles.description: A former Delaware County Sheriff's Office deputy who sued the county for wrongful termination and allowing a sexually charged workplace has lost her case in federal court.Janine Senanayake, 39, claimed she was repeatedly harassed and then unjustly fired from …

articles.title: Locked Up as Punishment for Seeking Safety

articles.author: Breanna Edwards
articles.title: Ohio 9Food Stamp Millionaire9 Found Guilty of Welfare Fraud
articles.description: A white and wealthy Ohio man was found guilty of accepting more than $8,300 in food stamps and other welfare benefits, including Medicaid, over a two-year period for his suburban family. Read more...

articles.title: House Blocks Trump's Order To Deport Palestinian Man Living In U.S. For 39 Years
articles.description: Last month, with a deportation order hanging over his head, Amer Othman Adi, 57, and his family were making preparations to leave their life in Youngstown, Ohio, willingly.

articles.author: Cristen Manion
articles.title: ICE: Youngstown business owner will be detained
articles.description: A Youngstown businessman, who rallied community support after receiving a temporary stay from deportation, is once again facing a future that's up in the air.
